channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken parking signpost ( Parkers Row, Bermondsey), 17th December
item.description:
A parking signpost is broken and is lying across the pavement, partially obstructing the footway. Please can this be made safe and the sign reinstated. It is located very close to the Most Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church, Bermondsey. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parker's Row, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal multi occupancy, 17th December
item.description:
This house is being used as an illegal multi occupancy housing. They have up to 6 delivery moped drivers living there and people coming and going. The shed at the back has rats running around as it is full of old beds and rubbish . There is a preschool next door which has had problems with rats since this started.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21,23, Falconwood Parade, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (offensive)

item.title: 7 Great Queen's Street, WC2B 5DH, 17th December
item.description:
A missing drain cover in front of All Good grocery shop, causing a hole in the pavement about 8ins in diameter. I caught my foot in it and only narrowly avoided falling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wild Street, Greater London

item.description:
There is some large items left all along battle road in the grass verges opposite ashburnham, Gordon and Stanmore Road and they need clearing up and removing

item.title: Constant Dog fouling irresponsible owners, 17th December
item.description:
I we are tired of years don’t having to walk in th road (often with cases) due to constant on-going dog fouling due to irresponsible owners not picking up after their dogs. This street has been used as a toilet for years and dog fouling stickers / signs need to be put in place, especially for those who don’t keep a car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Sutton Road, Colney Hatch, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is repeated dog fouling along this walkway which is used by many parents and children on the school run., 17th December
item.description:
The dog fouling is not just along the pavements but also on the grassy verge. Many children on their school journey have walked over the dog mess and potentially taken the mess on their shoes and into school grounds. It is a public health hazard and also a risk to people having to walk into the cycle lane to avoid the dog mess. This pavement is a very popular school route.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: House on corner of ashburnham Road not using bin bags, 17th December
item.description:
Council needs to make contact with residents of 93 Ashburnham Road as they are littering the battle road and ashburnham Road frequently and are not putting their waste out in bins correctly. There is constantly litter and rubbish surrounding this house and mess all over the floor. They are putting rubbish in bins without bin bags and messing up our whole road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battle Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on the flyover the A2 black prince junction, 17th December
item.description:
Yes, again there a pothole on the flyover A2 at the black prince which requires some Attention, also when will the whole length of the flyover between the two roundabouts be correctly maintained as the is dips on the road surface, and when will the kerbs that are damaged be replaced. When it rain the roundabout at the bottom of gravel hill drains need to be inspected and made safe as when it rains the roundabout flood will surface water which causes traffic to avoid the surface water. On the whole it’s not the first time l have reported and informed the council of the problems and poor road surface around the roundabout and the flyover. It would to see improved of the road and all outstanding traffic issues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycle hangers, 17th December
item.description:
Can you explain why we have now 3 Bicycle hangers in a stretch of road approx 50m long and non in the next road. These hangers hold 6 bikes which suggests 18 residents use bikes.Now that you have removed parking from balls pond road residents have no parki

item.title: No lightning in Erin close, 17th December
item.description:
Erin Close has no lightning at all and there were several incidents in the past years: - a vehicle was stolen - a vehicle was broken into - resident installed lights on garages were cut and damaged With both elderly and small kids living in the close proper street lighting could improve security
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erin Close, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped bulky items at the top of Telford Avenue, 17th December
item.description:
Several large items (single mattress, bed frame (?) and a large flat screen TV) have been flytipped in the last few days on top of a pile of Serco bags of leaves on the pavement on the north side near Conway House at the end of the road currently closed off due to TfL works.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telford Avenue, Streatham Hill, Greater London
